meanings.definition: action or speech that makes someone angry or annoyed
meanings.sent1: Her constant teasing was a provocation to him.
meanings.sent2: The rude comment was a provocation that led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy's playful provocation always put a smile on everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise outside was a provocation to his already frayed nerves.
meanings.sent5: The deliberate provocation in her tone left no room for misunderstanding.

meanings.definition: the act of provoking or inciting
meanings.sent1: The provocation of the protestors only fueled their determination.
meanings.sent2: His provocation of the crowd resulted in chaos.
meanings.sent3: The magician's provocation of the audience made the show even more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The provocation of the bees led to a swarm of activity.
meanings.sent5: The provocation of the enemy troops sparked a fierce battle.

meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked cookies was a provocation for her hunger.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling movie was a provocation for adrenaline junkies.
meanings.sent3: The colorful artwork was a provocation for creativity in the students.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset served as a provocation for romantic feelings.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle was a provocation for his intellect.
